snippet: The looming negotiations with the city’s unions over new contracts will give Mayor Bill de Blasio the chance to be a tougher kind of progressive.
abstract: Editorial holds that looming negotiations over New York City's union contracts will give Mayor Bill de Blasio, presenting his first budget, the chance to be a tougher kind of progressive; holds de Blasio will have to demand concession from his union allies if he is going to have the funds to pursue his ambitious liberal agenda.
lead_paragraph: The looming negotiations with the city’s unions over new contracts will give Mayor Bill de Blasio the chance to be a tougher kind of progressive.
